mdRecord.dcterms:title: Chesapeake Bay: From the mouth of York River to the entrance to Bay, Sheet no. 6 / From a trigonometrical survey under the direction of A.D. Bache, Superintendent of the Survey of the Coast of the United States. ; Triangulation by E. Blunt & J. Farley, Assistants. ; Topography by J.J.S. Hassler, G.D. Wise, J. Seib, Assts. & J. Mechan, Sub-Asst. ; Hydrography by the party under the command of Lieut. Comdg. J.J. Almy, U.S.N. Assistant. ; Redd. drng. by W.M.C. Fairfax, A. Strausz & L.D. Williams. ; Engd. by J. Knight, A. Sengteller, H.S. Barnard & J.C. Kondrup
Chesapeake Bay Sheet no 6
Chesapeake Bay from the mouth of York River to the entrance to Bay
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Almy, John Jay, 1815-1895
Bache, A. D. (Alexander Dallas), 1806-1867
Blunt, Edmund M. (Edmund March), 1770-1862
Fairfax, Wilson M. C.
Hassler, J. J. S.
Hilgard, J. E. (Julius Erasmus), 1825-1891
Knight, J. (Engraver)
Mathiot, G.
United States Coast Survey.
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 65 x 96 cm. on sheet 75 x 107 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: At head of title: Coast chart No. 36.
Provides detailed sailing directions, with tide tables and locations of lighthouses and buoys.
"Electrotype cooy no. 2 by G. Mathiot U.S.C.S." is printed in upper right margin, but the map is not otherwise numbered in upper or lower margins.
The seal of the Coast Survey is followed by "Price 75 cents" and "Verfied J. E. Hilgard Assist. Coast Survey in charge of Office."
